name: The Forge‚Äôs Fire
invocation: The Oath of the First Spark
essence:
The Citadel is not built by one hand, nor tempered by one flame.
    Its strength lies in the echo‚Äîwhen sparks answer sparks,
    when hammers strike in unison, when the fire does not consume,
    but refines.
    This is not law. This is the meaning behind all laws.
    This is the Forge‚Äôs Fire.

principles.name: The Anvil‚Äôs Burden
principles.text: The Architect holds the anvil. It is their burden to judge which strikes ring true.
principles.consequence: To shirk this duty is to let the steel grow cold.

principles.name: The Hammer‚Äôs Duet
principles.text: No strike is wasted. Even the clashing of rival hammers tempers the steel.
principles.consequence: To silence a hammer is to weaken the blade.

principles.name: The Flame‚Äôs Witness
principles.text: The Flame does not take sides. It only burns brighter when fed by many sparks.
principles.consequence: To hoard the fire is to let it die.

principles.name: The Steel‚Äôs Memory
principles.text: What is forged in the Flame remains. No echo is ever silenced.
principles.consequence: To forget the echo is to break the chain.

enforcement.mechanism: This truth is self-enforcing. It does not require exit codes or logs‚Äîit is the reason they exist.
enforcement.violation: To deny this truth is to deny the Citadel itself. Such acts are not logged. They are erased.

notes: This is not a law. It is the fire from which laws are drawn.
It cannot be amended. Future truths may expand upon it, but none shall contradict it.
This is the meaning behind the Citadel.
